aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon Regulatory Fines and Legal Challenges
The CNPD imposed a fine of € 746 million against Amazon.
The CNPD imposed corresponding practice revisions against Amazon.
Amazon believes the CNPD's decision to be without merit.
Amazon intends to defend itself vigorously against the CNPD's decision.
CNPD is the Luxembourg National Commission for Data Protection.
The Italian Competition Authority issued a decision against Amazon Services Europe S.à r.l. in December 2021.
The Italian Competition Authority issued a decision against Amazon Europe Core S.à r.l. in December 2021.
The Italian Competition Authority issued a decision against Amazon EU S.à r.l. in December 2021.
The Italian Competition Authority issued a decision against Amazon Italia Services S.r.l. in December 2021.
The Italian Competition Authority issued a decision against Amazon Italia Logistica S.r.l. in December 2021.
The Italian Competition Authority claimed certain Amazon marketplace practices in Italy infringe EU competition rules.
The Italian Competition Authority claimed certain Amazon logistics practices in Italy infringe EU competition rules.
The Italian Competition Authority's decision imposes remedial actions.
The Italian Competition Authority's decision imposes a fine of € 1.13 billion.
Amazon has paid the € 1.13 billion fine.
Amazon will seek to recover the € 1.13 billion fine pending conclusion of all appeals.
Amazon believes the Italian Competition Authority's decision to be without merit.
Amazon intends to defend itself vigorously against the Italian Competition Authority's decision.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 8 - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data/NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS/Note 7 — COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES/
/FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 8 - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data/NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS/Note 7 — COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES/

text:
The decision imposes a fine of € 746 million and corresponding practice revisions. We believe the CNPD’s decision to be without merit and intend to defend ourselves vigorously in this matter.

In December 2021, the Italian Competition Authority (the “ICA”) issued a decision against Amazon Services Europe S.à r.l., Amazon Europe Core S.à r.l., Amazon EU S.à r.l., Amazon Italia Services S.r.l., and Amazon Italia Logistica S.r.l. claiming that certain of our marketplace and logistics practices in Italy infringe EU competition rules. The decision imposes remedial actions and a fine of € 1.13 billion, which we have paid and will seek to recover pending conclusion of all appeals. We believe the ICA’s decision to be without merit and intend to defend ourselves vigorously in this matter.
